intro: Vicia narbonensis var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy vetch, is a flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often used as a cover crop due to its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Vicia narbonensis var. pilosa is native to southern Europe and is adapted to a variety of soil types.
